trans-unit.source: Include jQuery: Enable this option to include jquery
Selector for container: Enter the identifier which selects only the items/entries you want to paginate. Sample: div.news-list-container
Selector for Scroll Container: In which container the scrollbar is placed? Sample: $(window)
Selector for Item: Enter the identifier which selects one single item within the list container. Sample: div.news-list-item
Selector for Paginator: Enter the identifier for the paginator. This part will be set to display:none if infinite scrolling works. Sample: div.news-list-browse

Selector for next link: Enter the identifier for the next link. InfiniteScrolling will read the href attribute to read the container of next page and append it to current container. Sample: div.browseLinksWrap a:eq(-2)
Loader icon: Enter your own loader icon if you want. Please enter a full img-tag including src, alt, width and height attributes

Loader delay: If you want the user to see the loader icon working you should set this value to something higher than 0. Values in milliseconds. If you want to show the data directly it's better to set this value to 0
Amount of requests: Infinite scrolling works to the given amount of requests. If requests are reached a link for requesting additional data appears
Request Text: This is the text for the link above

Request Margin: When should the request start? If 0 request starts if the user scrolls to bottom of page. If you enter -100 the request starts just 100 Pixel before bottom of page is reached. Positive values does not work!

When this option is enabled, the extension will add anchors to the URL of the page in the form #/page/1, #/page/2. This feature allows to set bookmarks in the browser to a specific section of the list.
